chapter.title: Processing Returns
chapter.para: It's always good customer service to have a returns policy. Because of this, most retailers provide their Customers with the ability to return unused or defective products. Processing Returns in xTuple POS is as easy as processing Sales.

section.title: Creating a Return
section.para: To create a Return, begin on the Cash Register screen. The rest of the steps are described below:

listitem.para: Select the NEW button—this will open the Retail Sale screen
In the "Number" field, the next retail Sale number is entered automatically
From the "Type" field, select the "Return" option
Locate the Customer information using the lookup button [...]

note.para: Returns are made by Customers who purchased products from you in the past. This means the information on these Customers should already be in the database.

listitem.para: The Customer portion of the Return in now completed, as shown in the following screen:

section.para: Next we have to specify which Items are being returned. To specify the Items being returned, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Specify the Item being returned in the "Item Number" field
Then enter the quantity being returned
The results are shown in the following screen:

section.para: Finally, navigate to the "Detail" tab and finalize the Return using these steps:

listitem.para: Select the Sales Rep who is handling the Return

note.para: A Sales Rep is required to process a Return. If your system is configured to insert the name of the logged-in user as the Sales Rep, then this will be done automatically.

listitem.para: Enter any notes related to the Return
Once you are done, you're ready to select the REFUND button
The next screen shows a Return ready for final processing:

As you can see in the screenshot, we are assuming for this scenario that we are giving the Customer a cash refund. However, Credit Card refunds can also be issued. Keep in mind that when issuing a Credit Card refund, the amount in the Cash amount field must be less than the total due. This will ensure the "Credit Card" option is enabled so you can use it.
